messages.title: IT'S TIME TO MAKE A CHOICE
messages.content: Dear Rushcliffe resident, On May 7th you have an opportunity to make a change. Together we intend to tackle austerity with a strong plan for the wealth generated and the wealth distributed to become more properly shared. We will start to ease family burdens, and begin to build larger employments to strengthen our services and protect a country where the potential and passion of each person is the wealth of a nation. We work better together. David

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Labour candidate mentions plans to scrap the non-dom rule so that everyone who lives here pays tax here and to stop tax incentives that help people and companies move abroad to avoid paying UK taxes. They also plan to raise the minimum wage to £8 per hour over the next Parliament.

issues.economy: Tackle austerity with a strong plan for wealth to be more properly shared. Plans to scrap the non-dom rule and stop tax incentives that help people and companies move abroad to avoid paying UK taxes.
issues.socialWelfare: Plan to raise the minimum wage to £8 per hour over the next Parliament.

quotes.text: David Cameron has presided over a country which has become more divided and unequal each passing year.
